channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road has become a rubbish heap, 18th October
item.description:
More regular street cleaning is overdue on Bodney Road. It is continuously neglected by the council

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Big items of rubbish dumped next to private parking area including few big metal items and a black bin, 18th October
item.description:
This area has atarted to becime a hotspot of flytipping and qe had reported numerous times , rubbish were dumped at public area where children play ad dogs walk daily. Previous claim hasnt been dealt with and now more rubbish dumped right next to this private parking area,it is distressing, to face it day to day infront of our door steps. It is not good for our mental and physical health. Please deal with it and put a sign to say it is not a pit and penulties should be applied. Thank you in advance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Brantwood Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over Craigâ€™s Court, 18th October
item.description:
Bags dumped outside bt exchange - reported yesterday - more added !? excrement outside fire exit of Silver Cross food bins and other waste outside old shades - please get rid of some bins - starting with street cleaner and move other bins into a commercial area - why us this corner of Whitehall despite being residential always so filthy full of crushed glass excrement and pub's waste !??? please close it at least once oer year for cleaning - how can it be acceptable that this is continuing to be so filthy next to homes and businesses serving drinks and food !???

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Emergency access gates left open AGAIN, 18th October
item.description:
Gates that should be accessible only to Southwark- and emergency vehicles have, yet again, been left unlocked. Selfish drivers have then left the gates open. Please lock them. And please find a permanent solution to this chronic issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Square, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bag of rubbish and general litter., 18th October
item.description:
Outside st Paulinus Church. Dumped rubbish bag and litter all along the road, by the pavement in the gutter. Yr litter pick colleague picked up litter from the opposite side of the road on Friday am but did not cross onto St Paulinus Church side of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
